A new species of Encarsia (Hymenoptera, Aphelinidae) developing on ficus whitefly Singhiella simplex (Hemiptera, Aleyrodidae) in China and Taiwan
Article
Full-text available
  • Nov 2015
  • Chiun-Cheng Ko
  • Yuan Tung Shih
  • Stefan Schmidt
  • Andrew Polaszek
Encarsia singhiellae Polaszek & Shih, sp. n., is described and illustrated. It is known so far from Taiwanand China. All specimens were reared from the ficus, or fig, whitefly Singhiella simplex (Singh), an Asian species recently attaining pest status in California, Colombia, and Florida.

The genus Scelio is a cosmopolitan and speciose group of solitary parasitoids of the eggs of short-horned grasshoppers (Orthoptera: Acrididae). A number of these hosts are important pests, including plague locusts of the genus Schistocerca. Projects

Projects (11)
Identify the parasitoid wasp in Iraq
Project
Parasitoid wasps are a large group of hymenopteran superfamilies. The project aims to identify the important parasitoid wasp in Iraq's fauna.
View
Signiphoridae
Project
View
Fall armyworm research in South Africa
Project
The overarching goals of our current research are to: • determine relationships between pest infestation levels and yield loss • determine susceptibility of FAW to insecticides with different modes of action • monitor the status of susceptibility of FAW to Bt maize • study pest development - temperature relationships and cold stress tolerance in order to identify areas where FAW may establish permanently in Africa • study the host range and preference of moths for certain host plants • study the ecology of FAW in South Africa • survey of biological control agents of FAW
View
